error.regex: Error: \.github/workflows/[\w.-]+\.yml.*(?:Unexpected value|Invalid workflow file|mapping values are not allowed)

verdict.summary: GitHub Actions workflow YAML file contains syntax errors such as incorrect indentation, invalid keys, or malformed expressions. The workflow fails before any jobs run.

dead_ends.action: Blindly re-indent the entire YAML file with a text editor auto-format
dead_ends.why_fails: Auto-formatters can break YAML anchors, multi-line strings, and GitHub Actions-specific syntax like ${{ }} expressions

dead_ends.action: Copy a workflow template from an outdated blog post without adapting it
dead_ends.why_fails: GitHub Actions syntax evolves; older templates may use deprecated keys or removed features

dead_ends.action: Ignore the error and re-run the workflow hoping it passes
dead_ends.why_fails: Syntax errors are deterministic and will never self-resolve on retry

workarounds.action: Validate the workflow YAML locally using actionlint before pushing
workarounds.how: Install actionlint (brew install actionlint or download binary), run 'actionlint .github/workflows/ci.yml' and fix all reported issues

workarounds.action: Use the GitHub Actions workflow editor in the browser for real-time validation
workarounds.how: Navigate to repo > Actions > New workflow, paste your YAML, and fix any red-underlined errors before committing

leads_to.condition: When fixing syntax reveals permission issues in the corrected workflow

preceded_by.condition: When editing workflow to fix Node version and introducing YAML syntax errors

frequently_confused_with.distinction: GitHub Actions uses YAML workflow files while Jenkins uses Groovy-based Jenkinsfile syntax
